headline.print_headline: Lessons of Past Disasters Help Mexico Sidestep the Brunt of a Hurricane
headline.main: Lessons of Past Disasters Helped Mexico Sidestep the Brunt of a Hurricane

byline.contributor: William Neuman and Elisabeth Malkin reported from Mexico City. Azam Ahmed contributed reporting from Cihuatlán, Mexico, Paulina Villegas from Barra de Navidad, Mexico, and Frances Robles from Miami.
byline.original: By WILLIAM NEUMAN and ELISABETH MALKIN

snippet: The country had no immediate reports of deaths or damages to major infrastructure, a result that experts attributed to a combination of luck and planning based on past disasters.
abstract: Mexican authorities, using lessons learned from previous environmental disasters, worked effectively to warn and evacuate local residents in path of Hurricane Patricia; nation's organized efforts helped to avoid any deaths or damage to infrastructure.
lead_paragraph: The country had no immediate reports of deaths or damages to major infrastructure, a result that experts attributed to a combination of luck and planning based on past disasters.
